questions.answer_description:
AWS CloudFormation intrinsic functions are special actions you use in your template to assign values to properties not available until runtime. Each function is declared with a name enclosed in quotation marks (""), a single colon, and its parameters.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/intrinsic-fuctions-structure.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

A. intrinsic functions

AWS CloudFormation intrinsic functions are special actions that you can use in your CloudFormation templates to assign values to properties that are not known or available until runtime. Intrinsic functions allow you to perform transformations, calculations, and conditional logic within your CloudFormation templates.

Examples of intrinsic functions include Fn::Ref, which retrieves the value of the specified parameter or resource, Fn::GetAtt, which retrieves the value of an attribute from a resource in the template, and Fn::Sub, which substitutes variables within a string with their corresponding values.

By using intrinsic functions, you can dynamically assign values to properties and make your CloudFormation templates more flexible and reusable.
Correct answer

When you use AWS CloudFormation, you might encounter issues when you create, update, or delete AWS CloudFormation stacks.
For Amazon EC2 issues, view the cloud-init and cfn logs. These logs are published on the Amazon EC2 instance in the /var/log/ directory. These logs capture processes and command outputs while AWS CloudFormation is setting up your instance. For Windows, view the EC2Configure service and cfn logs in %
ProgramFiles%\Amazon\EC2ConfigService and C:\cfn\log.
You can also configure your AWS CloudFormation template so that the logs are published to Amazon CloudWatch, which displays logs in the AWS Management
Console so you don't have to connect to your Amazon EC2 instance.
Reference:
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/troubleshooting.html

questions.question_text: True or false: In CloudFormation, you cannot create an Amazon RDS DB instance from a snapshot.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. False, you can specify it in resource properties

The correct answer is C. False, you can specify it in resource properties.

In CloudFormation, you can create an Amazon RDS DB instance from a snapshot by specifying it in the resource properties of the AWS::RDS::DBInstance resource. The DBSnapshotIdentifier property allows you to specify the identifier of the snapshot from which the DB instance should be created.
C. False, you can specify it in resource properties
